name: EC2 Instances
description: Virtual servers in the AWS cloud for compute workloads

definitions.beginner: EC2 instances are virtual computers you can rent from AWS to run your applications, similar to having your own server but in the cloud.
definitions.advanced: Amazon EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) provides resizable compute capacity through virtual machine instances with various instance types optimized for different use cases, supporting multiple operating systems and offering features like auto-scaling, load balancing, and spot pricing.

commands.description: List all EC2 instances in your account

commands.example: aws ec2 run-instances --image-id ami-0abcdef1234567890 --count 1 --instance-type t2.micro --key-name MyKeyPair

flags.description: AMI ID to launch the instance from
Key pair name for SSH access

examples.title: Launch a Basic Web Server
examples.description: Create a simple EC2 instance for hosting a web application
examples.code:
# Launch an Ubuntu instance
aws ec2 run-instances \
  --image-id ami-0c02fb55956c7d316 \
  --count 1 \
  --instance-type t2.micro \
  --key-name my-key-pair \
  --security-group-ids sg-12345678 \
  --tag-specifications 'ResourceType=instance,Tags=[{Key=Name,Value=WebServer}]'
examples.scenario: Setting up a basic web server instance in AWS

examples.title: Connect to Instance via SSH
examples.description: Access your EC2 instance using SSH
examples.code:
# Get instance public IP
aws ec2 describe-instances --instance-ids i-1234567890abcdef0 --query 'Reservations[0].Instances[0].PublicIpAddress'

# Connect via SSH
ssh -i "my-key-pair.pem" ubuntu@54.123.45.67
examples.scenario: Connecting to a running EC2 instance for administration
